availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Cash (Caldwell County, KY, wool carder and grocery merchant)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, wool carder and grocery merchant. Virginia native. Married to Mariah Gates Cash in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on July 30, 1823. Father of Sarah B. Cash, John W. Cash, Joseph H. Cash, and Lucy Cash. Wool carder in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Grocery merchant in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 281A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 817.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 107.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 508B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 130.
